item.title: The Missing Cheatsheet For Brilliant Color Combinations
item.description:
The Missing Cheatsheet For Brilliant Color Combinations

Our world is filled with color. When presented in one of its infinite variations it can do everything from convey a message or even influence an emotion. Writing on color can be found all the way through history, from the journals of Leonardo Da Vinci to analysis of the inks chosen by painters of the Renaissance.

item.title: Rex Jung - Creativity and the Everyday Brain
item.description:
Rex Jung - Creativity and the Everyday Brain

Few features of humanity are more fascinating than creativity; and few fields are more dynamic now than neuroscience. Rex Jung is working on a cutting edge of science, exploring the differences and interplay between intelligence and creativity.

item.title: Dear Design Student
item.description:
Dear Design Student

Advice on design from people who work for a living.

item.title: What You Need to Consider Before You Go Freelance: A Checklist
item.description:
What You Need to Consider Before You Go Freelance: A Checklist

Chucking the corporate life for the freedom of working independently is the fantasy of many a cubicle monkey. But before you make the jump, ask yourself some hard questions to make sure that you can operate from a position of strength while on your own.

item.title: What if there were products based on drawings that make Don laugh?
item.description:
What if there were products based on drawings that make Don laugh?

Don Moyer, Calamityware, BADbandana, bad bandana, calamity ware, puzzles, bad neighborhood

item.title: 5 Things No One Tells You About Going Full-Time Again
item.description:
5 Things No One Tells You About Going Full-Time Again

Everyone writes about going from full-time to freelance, but we’re here to present lessons from the other side.
